creator: Amanda Silberling
title: (No AI) Employees at Google and OpenAI support Anthropic’s Pentagon stand in open letter
dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
content: While Anthropic has an existing partnership with the Pentagon, the AI company has remained firm that its technology not be used for mass domestic surveillance or fully autonomous weaponry.
contentSnippet: While Anthropic has an existing partnership with the Pentagon, the AI company has remained firm that its technology not be used for mass domestic surveillance or fully autonomous weaponry.

title: (No AI) We don’t have to have unsupervised killer robots
author: Hayden Field
content:
![A photo showing a flag surrounded by warning symbols](https://platform.theverge.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2025/12/STK432_Government__CVirginia_D.jpg?quality=90&strip=all&crop=0,0,100,100)

It's the day of the Pentagon's looming ultimatum for Anthropic: allow the US military [unchecked access](https://www.theverge.com/ai-artificial-intelligence/883456/anthropic-pentagon-department-of-defense-negotiations) to its technology, including for mass surveillance and fully autonomous lethal weapons, or potentially be designated a "supply chain risk" and potentially lose hundreds of billions of dollars in contracts. Amid the intensifying public statements and threats, tech workers across the industry are looking at their own companies' government and military contracts wondering what kind of future they're helping to build.

While the Department of Defense has spent weeks negotiating with Anthropic over removing its guardrails, including allowing t …

[Read the full story at The Verge.](https://www.theverge.com/ai-artificial-intelligence/885963/anthropic-dod-pentagon-tech-workers-ai-labs-react)
contentSnippet:
It's the day of the Pentagon's looming ultimatum for Anthropic: allow the US military unchecked access to its technology, including for mass surveillance and fully autonomous lethal weapons, or potentially be designated a "supply chain risk" and potentially lose hundreds of billions of dollars in contracts. Amid the intensifying public statements and threats, tech workers across the industry are looking at their own companies' government and military contracts  wondering what kind of future they're helping to build. 
While the Department of Defense has spent weeks negotiating with Anthropic over removing its guardrails, including allowing t …
Read the full story at The Verge.
summary: It's the day of the Pentagon's looming ultimatum for Anthropic: allow the US military unchecked access to its technology, including for mass surveillance and fully autonomous lethal weapons, or potentially be designated a "supply chain risk" and potentially lose hundreds of billions of dollars in contracts. Amid the intensifying public statements and threats, tech workers […]

title: (No AI) The Galaxy S26 is a photography nightmare
author: David Pierce
content:
![](https://platform.theverge.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2026/02/VRG_VST_0227_Site.jpg?quality=90&strip=all&crop=0,0,100,100)

In many ways, Samsung's new phones [are fairly normal upgrades](https://www.theverge.com/tech/884239/samsung-galaxy-s26-plus-price-specs-gemini). The S26 lines come with some useful new things - particularly [the Privacy Display on the S26 Ultra](https://www.theverge.com/tech/884337/samsung-galaxy-s26-ultra-privacy-display-price), which looks like an extremely cool bit of tech and a really useful new feature - and a lot of iterative year-over-year changes. The new camera features, on the other hand, are neither of those things. They're something worse. Something scarier.

![](https://platform.theverge.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2025/11/Vergecast-Tile-Large.jpeg?quality=90&strip=all&crop=0,0,100,100)

_Verge_ subscribers, don't forget you get exclusive access to ad-free _Vergecast_ wherever you get your podcasts. Head [here](https://www.theverge.com/account/podcasts). Not a subscriber? You can [sign up here](https://www.theverge.com/subscribe).

On [this episode of _The Vergecast_](https://pod.link/vergecast), Nilay and David discuss the new phones, …

[Read the full story at The Verge.](https://www.theverge.com/podcast/885942/samsung-galaxy-s26-ai-camera-nightmare-vergecast)

In many ways, Samsung's new phones are fairly normal upgrades. The S26 lines come with some useful new things - particularly the Privacy Display on the S26 Ultra, which looks like an extremely cool bit of tech and a really useful new feature - and a lot of iterative year-over-year changes. The new camera features, on the other hand, are neither of those things. They're something worse. Something scarier.

title: (No AI) OpenAI and Amazon announce strategic partnership
content: OpenAI and Amazon announce a strategic partnership bringing OpenAI’s Frontier platform to AWS, expanding AI infrastructure, custom models, and enterprise AI agents.
contentSnippet: OpenAI and Amazon announce a strategic partnership bringing OpenAI’s Frontier platform to AWS, expanding AI infrastructure, custom models, and enterprise AI agents.

title: (No AI) Introducing the Stateful Runtime Environment for Agents in Amazon Bedrock
content: Stateful Runtime for Agents in Amazon Bedrock brings persistent orchestration, memory, and secure execution to multi-step AI workflows powered by OpenAI.
contentSnippet: Stateful Runtime for Agents in Amazon Bedrock brings persistent orchestration, memory, and secure execution to multi-step AI workflows powered by OpenAI.

creator: Steven Levy
title: (No AI) Wall Street Has AI Psychosis
dc:creator: Steven Levy
content: A “thought experiment” about the impacts of AI sent stocks tumbling earlier this week. It’s probably going to keep happening.
contentSnippet: A “thought experiment” about the impacts of AI sent stocks tumbling earlier this week. It’s probably going to keep happening.

creator: David Nield
title: (No AI) Huxe Will Give You a Personalized, Daily Audio Summary Powered by AI
dc:creator: David Nield
content: The app reads your email inbox and your meeting calendar, then gives you a short audio summary. It can help you spend less time scrolling, but of course, there are privacy drawbacks to consider.
contentSnippet: The app reads your email inbox and your meeting calendar, then gives you a short audio summary. It can help you spend less time scrolling, but of course, there are privacy drawbacks to consider.
